content:
# We have successfully crafted a second stone furnace, and our inventory now includes:
# - 1 stone furnace
# - 12 wood
# - 5 coal
# - 1 iron plate
#
# Now we can set up both stone furnaces to smelt iron ore into iron plates more efficiently. 

# Let's place the second stone furnace next to the first one and insert iron ore and coal into both furnaces for smelting.

# Place the second stone furnace in the environment (assuming we have a function to place it).
place_item(Prototype.StoneFurnace, position=next_free_position())  # Place the second stone furnace.

# Insert coal and iron ore into the first furnace.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert 5 units of coal into the first furnace.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=10)  # Insert 10 units of iron ore into the first furnace.

# Insert coal and iron ore into the second furnace.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, second_furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert 5 units of coal into the second furnace.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, second_furnace, quantity=10)  # Insert 10 units of iron ore into the second furnace.

print(f"Inventory after inserting items into both furnaces: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Check inventory again.
print(f"Current status of both furnaces: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}, {inspect_inventory(second_furnace)}")  # Check the current status of both furnaces.
